subject: Re: How to test void methods using JUnit
msgSnippet: Your void method should have some observable behavior, so you need to test that behavior. For example, Collections.sort() returns void, but testing it is very
messageBody:
Your void method should have some observable behavior, so you need to
test that behavior. For example, Collections.sort() returns void, but
testing it is very easy. If your method has no observable behavior,
then do you need it?

Michael.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "speaktomk" <speaktomk@y...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I'm having a java application, i want to test all the methods available
> in this application.
> I can able to test the method having the return type like
> boolean,String,int,Vector,Hashtable.
>
> But i don't know how to test the void methods in this application.
>
> Please give the suggestions to test the void methods using JUnit.
>
> With Regards
> Karuppiah
